snippet: Decaying organic matter in the Salton Sea, a shrinking saline accident of irrigation in the Colorado Desert, is thought to have caused a sulfurous olfactory insult.
abstract: Decaying organic matter in the Salton Sea sends a sulfurous stench for hundreds of miles across southern California; lake, created by an irrigation accident in 1905, has been shrinking for decades and its salinity continues to rise; mass fish die-offs have become commonplace.
lead_paragraph: Decaying organic matter in the Salton Sea, a shrinking saline accident of irrigation in the Colorado Desert, is thought to have caused a sulfurous olfactory insult.

headline.seo: Salton Sea Is Blamed for Southern California Stench
headline.main: Lake Is Blamed for Stench Blown Across Southern California
headline.print_headline: Lake Blamed for Stench Blown Across Southern California
